chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Paris Leandre Mayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay Court costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments and DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to  11CF3160 and any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Vocational assessment.  Participate in any programs recommended.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Yang C and the location of 3100 W. St. Paul Avenue.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer user or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution Hearing proceeded.  Defendant stipulates to the amount of $738.23 to Yang Chang to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  Restitution to Progressive Insurance in the amount of $7,711.92 requested.  Defendant does not have the ability to pay restitution to Progressive.  Court, however, sets restitution in the amount of $7,711.92 to Progressive Insurance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR  consecutive to any other sentence 11CF3160 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution to be determined  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-No contact with Yang C. and the location of 3100 W. St. Paul Avenue
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Matter scheduled for a Restitution Hearing.  Defendant to appear via video conference.  Video technician notified of date.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penalty enhancer stricken.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Final Pre-Trial on August 10, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court appearing via telephone, defendant Paris Leandre Mayes not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to an emergency, defense counsel is not able to appear and requested an adjournment. State does not object. Case set for final pre-trial in Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Paris Leandre Mayes not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.   Defendant MUST BE PRODUCED for the next court date.  Matter will be set for a final pretrial, however, a guilty plea may be conducted.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Telephone call received from Mary Garvin-Guimont.  Adjournment of the 6/24/15 final pretrial requested.  Matter rescheduled.  Email sent to ADA Megan Carmody.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Paris Leandre Mayes not in court, in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Paris Leandre Mayes not in court, in custody.  
Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials; awaiting offer.  
Request for status date granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Paris Leandre Mayes not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations; defense awaiting offer.   Request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in custody.  Ron Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Yang C.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Paris Leandre Mayes in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
